author: Kay Harmon

review: We dumped our TV service from the cable company - and are using Netflix and Hulu instead over wireless.  This is the perfect way to go since you just plug it into the USB port of the TV.Start up is a bit slow, about 1-2 minutes before you can access Netflix, Hulu, or other apps.  They have a PBS app which is free and that is great!Only a few issues:If you don't use the TV often enough, it will not keep the stick charged - so you will have to plug it into an outlet to keep it working.If you reset the Roku you need to activate it again on the web site - and that is a bit of a pain...If the remote stops working - don't reset the Roku first- try pairing the remote with the Roku again; that seems to work.
author: Amazon Customer

review: The Roku streams video very smoothly but the remote has a tendency to stop working every so often.  There is a fairly simple process to reset it but it is an unnecessary PIA.  There are smart phone apps however to replace the remote that work very well.
